text: Upon ligand binding , the type II receptor transphosphorylates and activates the type I receptor .
Type I receptors can signal via several pathways .
We examined the effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on Smad phosphorylation , as the activation of Smad is considered to be a major signalling pathway for BMPs [ 17 ] .
B cells were cultured in serum-free media over night and then treated with <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for various time points .

Total protein lysates were prepared , and the amounts of the phosphorylated forms of <extra_id_0> Smad1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were determined by western blot analysis .

text: Interestingly , treatment with 500 ng / ml <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced phosphorylation of Smad .
The <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced phosphorylation was high at the earliest time point tested ( 15 minutes ) , and remained high for at least 48 hours ( Figure 5 ) .
A similar phosphorylation was observed in Ramos cells , but not in HL60 cells ( Figure 6 ) .

Furthermore , we also tested whether other known downstream signalling pathways of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could be triggered by <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human B cells .

However , we did not observe any significant changes in the level of phospho - <extra_id_0> STAT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or phospho - <extra_id_0> p38 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> upon <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment of B cells ( data not shown ) .
